name: Ginkgo
description: Ginkgo biloba, commonly known as ginkgo or maidenhair tree, is a species of gymnosperm tree native to China. It is the only living species in the order Ginkgoales, making it a living fossil unchanged for more than 200 million years. The tree is widely cultivated for its medicinal properties, particularly its leaf extract which is used to improve memory and cognitive function. Ginkgo trees can live for over 1000 years and are highly resistant to pollution, disease, and insect pests.
